medium: Black chalk on machine-made laid paper
provenance: From the estate of the artist to his widow, Ruth L. Sussman, and by descent to their daughter, Deborah June Sussman; transferred to Mia by her executor, Ross Sussman, Minneapolis.
text: Richard Sussman was born in Minneapolis and studied at the Minneapolis School of Art (now MCAD), then part of the Minneapolis Society of Fine Arts, Mia’s parent organization. After studying and working in New York and California, he returned to the Twin Cities, where he worked at a plumbing supply company and taught studio art at various colleges. Sussman liked rugged subjects, both natural and manmade. Here we see what appears to be the industrial infrastructure of a sandpit or cement factory.
title: Untitled
